H0.text: The exosphere, which is the outermost layer, is the layer of the atmosphere where most of Earth's weather occurs.

H1.text: The troposphere, which is the lowest layer of the atmosphere, is where most of Earth's weather occurs.

H2.text: The thermosphere, which has the highest temperature, is the layer of the atmosphere where most of Earth's weather occurs.

H3.text: The stratosphere, which contains a subâ€‘layer of ozone, is the layer of the atmosphere where most of Earth's weather occurs.

A4.text: It contains 80% of the total mass of the planetary atmosphere and 99% of the total mass of water vapor and aerosols, and is where most weather phenomena occur.
